parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To stand by, be urgent, befall one (as of evil), be at hand, impend. From epi and histemi; to stand upon, i.e. Be present.
Opportunely, in season, conveniently. Adverb from eukairos; opportunely.
Unseasonably, out of due season, inopportunely. Adverb from the same as akaireomai; inopportunely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I reprove, rebuke, discipline, (b) I expose, show to be guilty. Of uncertain affinity; to confute, admonish.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From epi and timao; to tax upon, i.e. Censure or admonish; by implication, forbid.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Patience, forbearance, longsuffering. From the same as makrothumos; longanimity, i.e. forbearance or fortitude.
Teaching, doctrine, what is taught. From didasko; instruction.
